subject: Climate & Environment
title: Landslides and Mudflows
description: A quick, practical guide to Landslides and Mudflows.

hook.text: After a wildfire, the next rain doesn't soak in. It slides down the hill carrying everything.

buildup.text: Saturated soil on steep slopes becomes heavy and unstable. Gravity does the rest.

discovery.text: Deforestation multiplies landslide risk. Tree roots are the glue that holds hillsides together.

twist.text: A single landslide in Colombia in 2017 killed 300 people in minutes while they slept.

climax.text: As extreme rainfall events increase, landslide-prone areas face growing danger each year.

punchline.text: Mountains look permanent. Heavy rain can prove otherwise.

quiz.question: Why does deforestation increase landslide risk?
options: Tree roots hold soil in place on slopes
Forests block wind that causes slides
